abstracts.cdata!:
The resettlement action plan aims to
            define the resettlement and compensation program so as to
            limit as much as possible the number of project affected
            persons (PAPs) and properties affected by the project, and
            to ensure that all PAPs will be compensated for their losses
            at replacement costs and will be provided with
            rehabilitation measures to assist them to improve, or at
            least maintain, their pre-project living standards and
            income earning capacity. All PAPs residing, working, doing
            business or cultivating land in the right of way of the
            transmission line, surrounding areas of the tower foundation
            and the surveys are entitled to be provided with
            rehabilitation measures sufficient to assist them to improve
            or at least maintain their pre-project living standards,
            income earning capacity, and production levels. Lack of
            legal rights to the assets lost will not bar the PAPs from
            entitlement to such rehabilitation measures. Rehabilitation
            measures also include agricultural land for land of equal
            productive capacity acceptable to the PAP or in cash at
            replacement cost according to PAPs choice; replacement of
            residential/premise land of equal size acceptable to the PAP
            or in cash at replacement cost according to choice; and
            transfer and subsistence allowances. The previous level of
            community services and resources will be maintained or
            improved. Financial resources will be provided and
            implementation arrangements will ensure effective and timely
            design, planning, consultation, and implementation of the
            inventories and resettlement action plans.
